description: Named after Indian physicist Satyendra Nath Bose (1894–1974)  +‎ -on; coined by English physicist Paul Dirac in 1945 in a lecture titled "Developments in Atomic Theory".

entries.meaning: (physics) A particle with totally symmetric composite quantum states, which exempts them from the Pauli exclusion principle, and that hence obeys Bose-Einstein statistics. They have integer spin. Among them are many elementary particles, and some (gauge bosons) are known to carry the fundamental forces. Compare fermion.
